result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Marcus Antonio Smiley was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is still in custody and has not been transported to a Mental Health facility.  ADA James C. Griffin submitted a FORTHWITH order to the Court.  Order signed and filed.
Request by ADA James C. Griffin to schedule motion hearing.  Case calendared for motion hearing on October 31, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Harley Emberson from WCS, also in court.  

Sentencing proceeded as to Phase 3:  Statements by the state and defense.

The Court rejected the conditional release plan and ordered defendant be committed to the Department of Health Services for a period of 12 years concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 368 days time served.   Orders signed and filed.   Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.  

Appeal rights given.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.
Predisposition Investigation by WCS, received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appearing by telephone.  Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled per ADA James Griffin so that defendant can be REMANDED.  The Court ordered defendant REMANED to the Department of Health Services.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on April 5, 2016 at 1:30.

Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties in court to discuss the commitment order that was required to accompany the Order for Predisposition Investigation.  Order signed and filed.
Email correspondence with attorneys to schedule review hearing.  Case calendared for review hearing on March 9, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea as to Phase 2.  Pursuant to the state's motion, the Court strikes the "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer as to counts 1 & 2.   

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.   

Based on the report dated November 25, 2015 by Dr. Colliins, the Court finds the defendant not guilty under the law by reason of his mental disease or defect.   Bail to continue.  PDI ordered.  Court ordered case adjourned for disposition with respect to phase 3 in Branch 26.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Marcus Antonio Smiley in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Defense counsel also requested NGI examination.  No objection from the State.  Order for Examinations, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 05:00 pm.
